body.description:
Americans, particularly younger generations, are staying away from institutional religion
and instead choosing multiple spiritual and religious sources. The numbers of self-
identified “spiritual but not religious” are rapidly increasing and traditional institutional
religion finds itself at a potential turning point. As spiritual seekers are taking the lead in
shaping a new faith in America, join a diverse panel of seekers, religiously faithful, and
those in between as they explore questions like, Are religion and spirituality the same?
Can you be spiritual but not religious? Is spirituality the new religion and what can
traditional religious institutions learn from sustained engagement with spiritual seekers?
body.name: Spirituality vs. Religion: Finding the Sacred in the 21st Century

body.description: When art meets technology, cool things tend to happen. Come meet the tech team behind the Colossal Collective's latest puppet, a magnificent peacock with over and 2500 individually addressed LED lights. You'll get a hands-on look at the project, and we'll discuss some of the advancements in hardware and software that are making large-scale art projects easier and cheaper than ever before.

performers.name: The Colossal Collective: Puppets, Pixels, and Programming

body.name: The Colossal Collective: Puppets, Pixels, and Programming

body.description: Boise transplant Jennifer Kite-Powell (Forbes) will be moderating a panel on how to get your newest innovation featured by top tech publications. Panel participants include Neel Patel (Wired), Alejandro Rojas (HuffPost), Chris Longo (Den of Geek) and more.

body.description: Hackfort Live! Yea, that's a thing and this year at Hackfort 2018, your favorite community radio station, Radio Boise and Culture Junkies, a new podcast lovingly dedicated to Boise's culture scene, will broadcast live on stage. This live podcast will feature interviews of key Hackfort's speakers and guests.
body.name: Culture Junkies: Live Podcast

body.description: Cyber-security is becoming a defense 'must' if we are to protect ourselves as a country in digital warfare. Meredith & Dan will be hosting a workshop demonstrating how their project D3P will change the landscape of ballot/voter protection in the digital landscape.

body.description: Amy Lyons, Director of optimism, Official Worm Momma, and Worm Wrangler Extraordinaire, will be sharing her candid enthusiasm as she discusses her beloved squirm of a colony, the practice and value of composting with worms, as well as the great impact worms make in the world around us.
body.name: Urban Worm Farm Workshop

body.description: Ubisoft Montreal veterans Ann Lemay and Ceri Young will be leading a workshop about writing narration for video game levels. Bring your pencils and your thinking cap, because this is an in-depth look at level creation. Play Assassins Creed Origins and then come hang with these rad and talented ladies.

performers.name: LEVEL UP: Write Your Own Game Level
Ceri Young, Lead Writer - WB Games Montreal

body.name: LEVEL UP: Write Your Own Game Level

body.description: Super stoked about the lineup for Hackfort? What better way to immerse yourself into our programming than meeting your favorite speaker? Join us for our Hackfort Kick-off Party for beers, tunes provided by DJ Michna and the chance to meet your favorite game-boss, tech journalist or robot engineer! Must have a Hackfort Badge to attend.

body.description: A radical re-imagining of Henry David Thoreau’s classic. Taking place over twenty-four hours, the film interlaces three contemporary narratives about the trappings of 21st century life and the unlikely heroes who dream dangerously of escape.
